Subject: Re: [junit] what is the purpose of TestDecorator
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=224061497; y=k3QNNp6VsjUvR_rt4owfRoP4pjHolCqZz-yH4CXU1MBR2z5p33TYltff_Hxph9xj0HMgAQ

You've probably been using decorators without even knowing about it. 
RepeatedTest is an example of one which wraps a test and runs it a 
number of times, and the JUnitPerf library 
(http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html) uses decorators to 
set a time limit or simulate a load on a test.

David Saff wrote:
> Srihari,
> 
> TestSetup is a good example of a TestDecorator.  It performs setup 
> before a suite of tests runs, and then tears down when the suite is done.
> 
> Good luck on your presentation!
> 
>     David Saff
> 
> venkata srihari wrote:
> 
> 
>>Hello All,
>>
>>Tomorrow i have a presentation to give on JUnit. So kindly help me 
>>with some doubts.
>>
>>i need a description on how to use TestDecorator 
>>(junit.extensions.TestDecorator) and where we exactly use it. Give me 
>>a simple example if possible.
>>
>>i appreciate ur time ...
>>
>>thanks and regards,
>>Srihari.
